GPT_response.background: London Mayor Sadiq Khan implemented the London Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) to address the harmful effects of air pollution caused by cars. However, the expansion of ULEZ has faced backlash from anti-ULEZ protesters, leading to threats and personal attacks against Khan and his family. The opposition to ULEZ reflects the political divisiveness surrounding efforts to reduce car usage and promote clean air in cities around the world.
GPT_response.summary: London Mayor Sadiq Khan's implementation of the London Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) has faced significant opposition, leading to threats and personal attacks against Khan and his family. The expansion of ULEZ has raised concerns among some Londoners and has caused a rift within the Labour Party. However, Khan remains committed to promoting cleaner air and believes that the benefits will outweigh the challenges. The outcome of the upcoming mayoral election in London will have significant implications for city leaders worldwide.
